data.title: Android NDK compile error
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- developing environments
   - NDK version: R13

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create cocos2dx project.
2. Modify proj.android-studio/app/jni/Application.mk adding:
APP_ABI := armeabi-v7a arm64-v8a x86 x86_64 mips mips64
3. Compile android project:
$ cocos compile -p android --android-studio

ERROR:

Android NDK: ERROR:/Users/xxx/Projects/Cocos2dx/SampleProject/proj.android-studio/../cocos2d/external/freetype2/prebuilt/android/Android.mk:cocos_freetype2_static: LOCAL_SRC_FILES points to a missing file
Android NDK: Check that /Users/xxx/Projects/Cocos2dx/SampleProject/proj.android-studio/../cocos2d/external/freetype2/prebuilt/android/mips/libfreetype.a exists or that its path is correct
/Developer/android-ndk-r13/build/core/prebuilt-library.mk:45: *** Android NDK: Aborting . Stop._

Or:
Check that /Users/xxx/Projects/Cocos2dx/SampleProject/proj.android-studio/../cocos2d/external/freetype2/prebuilt/android/x86_64/libfreetype.a exists or that its path is correct

The error appears when compiling for:
APP_ABI := mips
APP_ABI := mips64
APP_ABI := x86_64

Any help please?
Thanks.

data.title: PreloadEffect on android devices with new version of android
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14
- devices test on: Nexus 6P Android 7.1.1 [Samsung Galaxy A3 (2016) Android 5.1.1 - WORKS FINE]
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r12b

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add several .ogg to a project and call preloadEffect on them.
2. Watch in logcat how slowly they load (92 small .ogg files took 25 seconds on Nexus 6P).

I've described more details in this post: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/preloadeffect-very-slow-loading/33946

This is a critical issue. I'm forced to use .wav for now, because of loading time.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
[ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
[ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Enabling depth test and disabling depth mask equals disabling depth test in Android/IOS
data.body:
when i draw some translucent objects and opaque objects, i found translucent object in cocos3.13.1 will be drawed after all opaque objects.  And the code in CCRenderer.cpp handle transparent command like this
glEnable(GL_DEPTH_TEST);
glDepthMask(false);

In my opinion,  these codes mean it will do the depth test, if fragments fail the depth test, it will be discarded, otherwise if fragments pass the depth test, the color buffer will be updated but depth buffer will not.

But when i test the actual effect in Android/IOS, I found glDepthMask(false) works almost like glDisable(GL_DEPTH_TEST)， the depth test seemed not working.

So if disabling glDepthMask seems to  disable depth test, the transparent command will be excuted under depth test disabling. it will cause the far translucent objects will be seen above the near opaque objects.

if I want translucent object A to blend with opaque B , and  opaque C(nearer) will overlap with opaque B.

Then i will get the result of object A blending with (B and C), but i just want to A to blend with B.

I don't know whether my understanding of these code are right. So can you guys give me some advice ?

data.title: Refactor WebSocket to support SSL (wss)
data.body:
1. Supports wss protocol
2. Uses only one libwebsockets context, multiple wsi instances to avoid multi-thread issues
3. Uses lws_create_vhost to create multiple virtual host, different protocols works

This PR depends on https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin/pull/263

Discussion: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/websocket-supports-ssl-connections/34611

data.title: Android 7.1 Landscape Screen Orientation Issues
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.10
- devices test on: Google Pixel, Nexus 6P
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 10e

We have a game that is in landscape mode. The game works fine on Android 4.X, 5.X, 6.X and even 7.0 but for some reason on 7.1 devices it gets confused about the orientation and tries to set itself as portrait which breaks the game's layout and makes it unplayable. We have the following in our android manifest:

`android:screenOrientation="sensorLandscape"
              android:theme="@android:style/Theme.NoTitleBar.Fullscreen"
              android:configChanges="orientation">`

since we want the game to be adapt to either landscape orientations. 

Steps to reproduce

1.) Have device running Android 7.1 in portrait mode
2.) Open the game
3.) Turn device to landscape; game will remain in incorrect orientation

data.title: Fix Scheduler Bugs.(issue #17149)
data.body:
1. Fix bug that `Scheduler::schedulePerFrame` compares targets priority incorrectly.
2. (refer #17149) Fix bugs occur when two objects that have same address are inserted and removed in same tick. scheduler will always remove target from `_hashForUpdates` when unschedule target.

data.title: Font Atlas crashed in function FontAtlas::prepareLetterDefinitions after a memory warning emitted.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.14
- devices test on:iPad
- developing environments
   - NDK version:android-ndk-r10e
   - Xcode version:Version 8.2.1 (8C1002)
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  add a UIButton to scene
2. update the title of the button in a timer scheduler.
3. add many sprites to make system eject a memory warning. 
4.after  a memory warning emitted, the app will crashed on  line 443 of CCFontAtlas.cpp since _atlasTextures[_currentPage] is nullptr after FontAtlasCache::purgeCachedData called.  
![crashed2017-1-12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7941850/21876635/8f3c3a06-d8bf-11e6-90d8-2d54bb8a9fb3.jpg)


fixed:
 edit  CCFontAtlasCache.cpp , about line 45, add 2 lines as follow:
        **if(atlas.second->getReferenceCount()<=0){**
            atlas.second->purgeTexturesAtlas();
        **}**

data.title: Fix incorrect function name for calculateBillboardTransform
data.body: There is a spelling mistake in function name, `calculateBillbaordTransform` should be `calculateBillboardTransform`. This patch fixes it, but keeps the old function for backwards compatibility. Thanks!

data.title: Particle set display frame
data.body: I'm opening this because https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16986 hasn't been merged and it's still an issue

data.title: Fix scale9sprite polygon info
data.body: in case developers will  use spritesheet with polygon info, then UI created with these spriteframes will trigger the assertions in CCSprite.cpp.
